sentences.sContent: He was surrounded by a group of admirers.
sentences.sCn: 他的身边围了一群仰慕者。

sentences.sContent: The photo shows four men grouped round a jeep.
sentences.sCn: 照片上是四个男人围着一辆吉普车。

sentences.sContent: ...which could be why fewer people in that group actually made it to that point...
...When he looked closer he realized it was a huge group of bees...
...Business schools grade their students in part on their performance in group projects...
...When a group of craftsmen expends to include more members...
...Perhaps this group would be able to express clearly some benefits of the new technology that the more cautious doctors weren't ready to address...
...the group had discouraged television viewing for children younger than 2...
...the group took largely the same approach it did in1999...
...and half of that group had accepted pay cuts...
...Team up with your own group and see how creative you can get...
...The group started growing the plants in the school's cafeteria...

phrases.pCn: 控制组（自变量的一种处理方法）；实验对照组
利益集团（指有共同利益的一群人）
n. 同种同文化之民族
特殊群；特别小组；非凡群
学习集团，学习小组；学习研讨会
组长；车间班长；团体领袖

trans.tranOther: several people or things that are all together in the same place
to come together and form a group, or to arrange things or people together in a group
